p: Plant extracts that interact with the QS system of bacteria can form biofilms, which synthesize virulence factors or other compounds. Antibiotics kill or slow the growth of bacteria, and inhibitors sensitive to quorum or quorum quenchers weaken bacterial virulence. Studies have demonstrated that QS exists in Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Staphylococcus aureus, Vibrio fischeri, Vibrio harveyi, E. coli, and Vibrio cholerae [ 17].
